intro: Ceratostylis simplex, commonly known as the narrow-leaved helmet orchid, is a member of the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is a terrestrial herb with a short, stocky rhizome and produces a single, erect stem bearing a single, elongated flower. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and a distinctive, helmet-shaped spur that is a key identifying feature. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Ceratostylis simplex is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in botanical gardens and by orchid enthusiasts.
